job_details.Functieomschrijving:
We are looking for a Research Engineer, with passion for working on cutting edge problems that can help us create highly realistic, emotional and life-like synthetic humans through text-to-video., In this position, you'll be working at the heart of the dynamic Avatar Video Team helping with the research and development of our generative avatar performance abilities. In other terms, given conditioning signals such as audio, video or text you will be helping create models that guides the avatar's verbal and non verbal cues. You will also help us create high quality, production ready code and take ownership of production pipelines. This would include:
     * Building libraries to accelerate the iteration speed during development (abstracting common functionality, automating tests sweeps, visualising results etc.).
     * Developing, maintaining and deploying Computer Vision algorithms and models to update our product, integrating CI/CD.
     * Taking ownership of the full ML lifecycle from concept, development, testing, validation to deployment.
     * Adapting off-the-shelf solutions for the purposes of our product.
     * Contribute to a high-quality codebase, develop tests where necessary, and participate in code reviews.
     * Writing clean and efficient code, and defining best practices both in the code base you own and in adoption of the tools you build.
     * Optimising for deployment - turning prototypes into working solutions.
     * Developing production quality software, our teams work "full stack" with the ability to deliver direct to product and impact the world., You will work in a hybrid setting with an office in Amsterdam
job_details.full_text:
Research Engineer - Human Performance Synthesis

We are looking for a Research Engineer, with passion for working on cutting edge problems that can help us create highly realistic, emotional and life-like synthetic humans through text-to-video., In this position, you'll be working at the heart of the dynamic Avatar Video Team helping with the research and development of our generative avatar performance abilities. In other terms, given conditioning signals such as audio, video or text you will be helping create models that guides the avatar's verbal and non verbal cues. You will also help us create high quality, production ready code and take ownership of production pipelines. This would include:
     * Building libraries to accelerate the iteration speed during development (abstracting common functionality, automating tests sweeps, visualising results etc.).
     * Developing, maintaining and deploying Computer Vision algorithms and models to update our product, integrating CI/CD.
     * Taking ownership of the full ML lifecycle from concept, development, testing, validation to deployment.
     * Adapting off-the-shelf solutions for the purposes of our product.
     * Contribute to a high-quality codebase, develop tests where necessary, and participate in code reviews.
     * Writing clean and efficient code, and defining best practices both in the code base you own and in adoption of the tools you build.
     * Optimising for deployment - turning prototypes into working solutions.
     * Developing production quality software, our teams work "full stack" with the ability to deliver direct to product and impact the world., You will work in a hybrid setting with an office in Amsterdam

profile_classification.rationale: The job description heavily emphasizes the development and deployment of generative models for creating synthetic humans using text-to-video, and guiding avatar cues based on various inputs (audio, video, text). This aligns directly with the core responsibilities of a GenAI Engineer, particularly in areas like fine-tuning generative models and building production-ready software systems around them. While there's mention of ML lifecycle and computer vision, the primary focus is on generative AI applications.

job_tasks.justification: The core of the role involves 'creating models that guides the avatar's verbal and non verbal cues' using conditioning signals like audio, video, or text, and adapting 'off-the-shelf solutions for the purposes of our product'. This directly relates to developing and adapting generative models.
